question_sentence: The UK opened its first legal drugs consumption room in which city?
evidence: The centre, to be known as The Thistle, will offer addicts a space to take drugs in a clean and safe environment with nurse supervision, with the long-term goal of supporting recovery. Its opening represents victory in the city council's decade-long legal battle to depart from Westminster's hardline drugs policy.

question_sentence: Which app has soared in popularity in the US in light of a prospective ban on TikTok?
evidence: One of the fastest-growing social platforms in China, Xiaohongshu, also known as RedNote, has experienced a significant surge in downloads as American users prepare for TikTok's shutdown on 19 January. Similar to Instagram, the app allows users to upload photos and videos.

question_sentence: Who received the Presidential Medal of Freedom with Distinction, the United States' highest civilian honour?
evidence: Joe Biden had been scheduled to bestow the honour on the Pope in person, but presented it over the phone instead after calling off his Rome trip due to the California wildfires. Fewer than 10% of recipients fall into the highest "with Distinction" category – and that handful includes Biden himself, who received the honour in 2017 from outgoing president Barack Obama.

question_sentence: Republican representatives have introduced a bill with what name that would allow Donald Trump to purchase Greenland?
evidence: House Republicans unveiled a bill allowing President-elect Donald Trump to negotiate the purchase of Greenland, despite Denmark and Greenland repeatedly stating the territory is not for sale.

question_sentence: The huge Maha Kumbh Mela festival began in which country?
evidence: Up to 450 million Hindu pilgrims are expected to visit the city of Prayagraj, at the confluence of the Ganges, Yamuna and Saraswati rivers, to take part in purification rites. The Kumbh Mela takes place every 12 years, but the Maha or "grand" Kumbh Mela occurs only every 144 years.

question_sentence: Which rare comet payed us a visit this week for the first time in 160,000 years?
evidence: The Comet C/2024 G3 (ATLAS) may be visible to the naked eye. Its peak brightness occurred on 13 January, when it was closest to the Sun. It will stay in the evening sky until around 20 January, after which it will dip below the horizon and offer better viewing opportunities for those in the southern hemisphere.

question_sentence: Blue Origin reached orbit for the first time with a new rocket named after which Nasa astronaut?
evidence: "New Glenn", the latest spacecraft developed by Jeff Bezos' SpaceX rival, became the first Blue Origin rocket to reach Earth's orbit following a successful launch in Florida. The rocket is more than five times taller than the company's existing New Shepard rocket, which has taken passengers into space but has never been sent into orbit.

question_sentence: What is the name of the wild boar at the heart of a much-publicised legal dispute in France?
evidence: Authorities threatened to remove and potentially euthanise Rillette, the wild boar adopted by French horse breeder Elodie Cappe. The case ignited protests and a court ruled in Cappe's favour, allowing Rillette to stay with her and ordering the state to pay €1,500 in damages.

question_sentence: Which oil giant announced plans to cut 4,700 jobs?
evidence: The UK-based oil firm will cut around 5% of its 90,000 global workforce this year, in addition to around 3,000 external contractors. The job losses, understood to affect office-based staff, are part of cost-saving measures designed to reduce spending by $2 billion (£1.6 billion) by the end of 2026.

question_sentence: In which South Korean city did more than 3,000 police officers conduct a pre-dawn raid, leading to the detention of President Yoon Suk Yeol?
evidence: The Impeached South Korean president was detained for questioning following a staged police raid on the barricaded presidential compound in Seoul. Yoon Suk Yeol had been holed up in the residence since his impeachment last month after his brief attempt to impose martial law.

question_sentence: Which social media app surged in popularity this week amid concerns that TikTok could soon be banned in the US?
evidence: China-based app Xiaohongshu, also known as RedNote, surged to the top position on Apple’s US App Store as users flock to potential TikTok alternatives.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden delivered his farewell address to the nation Wednesday. In which area of the White House did the speech take place?
evidence: President Biden gave his farewell address from the Oval Office on Wednesday, capping four years in the White House and a 52-year career in public service.

question_sentence: Which food item is running low in many American grocery stores?
evidence: Bird flu and other factors have contributed to a widespread egg shortage in the US. In November and December alone, more than 17 million egg-laying hens died because of the virus — and it will take months to replace those flocks.

question_sentence: Israel and Hamas agreed to a ceasefire on Wednesday, potentially ending months of bitter fighting in which territory?
evidence: A three-phase agreement could soon pause the war in Gaza, and lead to the release of Israeli hostages and Palestinian prisoners.

question_sentence: Blue Origin, the company founded by Amazon billionaire Jeff Bezos, launched a new rocket to orbit this week. What is the rocket’s name?
evidence: Blue Origin sent its rocket New Glenn into orbit on Thursday. The successful mission positions the company to compete with Elon Musk's SpaceX, which has dominated the global launch market for years.

question_sentence: The world’s largest religious gathering began this week in which country?
evidence: Over the next six weeks, around 400 million people are expected to attend the Maha Kumbh Mela, or the festival of the Sacred Pitcher, in India’s northern state of Uttar Pradesh.

question_sentence: Which artificial color additive was banned from use in US foods and beverages this week?
evidence: The FDA this week banned the use of red dye No. 3 in food, beverages and ingested drugs more than 30 years after scientists discovered links to cancer in animals.

question_sentence: The BAFTA Awards celebrate which art form?
evidence: The nominees were recently announced for the 2025 BAFTA Awards, an event often seen as the British film industry's equivalent to the Oscars.

question_sentence: Which airline is being sued by the Department of Transportation over two "chronically delayed" flight routes?
evidence: A new lawsuit filed by the Department of Transportation alleges Southwest Airlines is harming passengers and fair competition across the industry after it operated two “chronically delayed flights” that caused widespread disruptions.

question_sentence: Which chain is ending a policy that lets anyone use its restrooms without making a purchase?
evidence: Starbucks said it is ending its “open-door” policy to deter homeless people and non-paying customers who have come to visit the stores solely for shelter and bathroom access.
